title: Riot just remove wards in general at this point, jesus christ you have a boner for bush camping
body: You're cutting ward duration from 180 to 120? Like wtf is even going through your brains right now? Why do you have such a twisted fetish for people getting insta-gibbed by some braindead {{item:3147}} loser the moment they're forced to facecheck a bush?

replies.body: Because anything that lets people avoid dying is bad for Riot's revenue stream. Big Plays, killstreaks, this is what the viewers want. And never forget, Riot balances the game for the VIEWERS watching from the sidelines, not the players who have to put up with it. Fair play is unhealthy, the people want bloodsport.
Seeing one side dominate (with or without killing spree) is boring. This would just amplify it. Honestly the final games of this worlds were pretty boring exactly bc they were 3 stomped games.
This is so fucking true.
The fnatic brush play, it even has a name.
Its because vision and wards in proplay are much more powerful than lower elos. Vision needs nerfs for pro.

that statement is stupid. I will tell you why.

99% of the player base contribute most to the  game. sponsors don't sponsor a game if the player base is not there. They sponsor popular games.

So if you ignore 99% of  the player base, your ignoring 99% of your potential revenue. 

So yes, 99% of the playerbase does matter. And if they get frustrated and leave, how do you think riot is going to make money. 

Please explain how putting a small percentage of the gaming population above the rest is ever a smart idea in the long run? I am waiting to see this.

Dont bother arguing with pika. He is a long riot defender. He vehemently believes that everyone should play like pro play.

Edit: A small thing that i observed and i just feel like sharing it, the last time i did a similar comment i got temporary suspended yet this time its cool. The boards rules are extremely weird. So yeah i dont understand humans.

That's not being a Riot defender, that's just having a stupid notion of how ranking and competition work. And calling Pika a Riot defender when he spent so much time insulting them about Sona, dang, I didn't think I would see this one day.

Sure as hell shows up everywhere else to defend riot.
Not like he cant be a riot defender and have a stupid opinion on who should be the focus of balance or are those 2 ideas mutually exclusive?

Because, again, playere LEARN over time. A bronze player today would stomp a plat player a year or two ago. The reality is the average skill of the playerbase increases over time. You NEED to balance over good players because how they play gets adapted by everyone else within a few months.

You can balance for both. Its just more difficult, and RIot doesn't want to make the effort. Bottom line they are lazy and short sighted. And this whole players get better? ROFL, yes players do get better over time, but most people who are bronze right now will NEVER get past silver, and that's a good 80 percent of your players will NEVER see play past silver. So if the game turns into steaming pile of crap for them because there is zero effort made to make playing down there FUN (YA KNOW THAT THINGS GAMES ARE SUPPOSED TO BE? FUN? RING ANY BELLS?) they will leave, and revenue will dry up faster than Pauly Shore's career.
They do balance for both, but the primary focus is pro. If its good in pro, it gets adjusted. If its good in lower elos, theyll usually wait to see if players adjust, then potentially adjust.

Well those 99.99% of people will never BE pro, I'd wager at least half of those don't watch pro, or care about pro, so how do you think this whole "we can't have nice things because of pro" goes over down there? They might put up with it for awhile, but end of last season and this season proves they are sick of it, and they are starting to leave. 

I'm not saying league will suddenly die because of it. They have so many players they can afford to bleed a million players a month and be around for years, but eventually it'll catch up with them because make no mistake, ALOT of players have already left because of this cluster of a season, and even more are just hanging on to see if they fix things next season, and I have zero confidence they will.
Theyll never be pro because pros are also getting better. Any bronze scrub today would be the new faker 10 years ago.
So that completely invalidates your own argument that balancing only for the pros is good, because the VAST majority of players will never even be NEAR that level.
